name: Kepler-215
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-215 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-215 is a star with 0.9920000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.03 times its radius. It is located 1607.62 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-215 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-215 b

Kepler-215 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.36 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-215.

The mass of Kepler-215 b is 3.09 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-215 b is 1.62 that of Earth. At 3.09 Earth masses, Kepler-215 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-215, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
